snippet: Fewer Americans are smoking cigarettes, a government agency reports, but a growing number are turning to cigars or loose tobacco labeled for pipe use, which are less heavily taxed.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that fewer Americans are smoking cigarettes, but a growing number are turning to cigarettelike cigars that can sell for as little as seven cents apiece or to making cigarettes from inexpensive loose tobacco labeled for pipe use.
lead_paragraph: Fewer Americans are smoking cigarettes, a government agency reports, but a growing number are turning to cigars or loose tobacco labeled for pipe use, which are less heavily taxed.

headline.seo: More Smokers Switch to Less-Taxed Loose Tobacco or Cigars, U.S. Says
headline.main: Big Cigars Offer Way for Smokers to Save
headline.print_headline: Big Cigars Offer Way For Smokers To Save
